Hello! Iâ€™m Reza Darooei, currently an FCS Postdoctoral Research Fellow in Software Engineering at the University of Bern, supported by the Swiss Government Excellence Scholarship. I hold a Ph.D. in Biomedical Engineering, specializing in OCT cyst segmentation using deep learning and sparse basis methods.

My research focuses on developing VR-based blended learning solutions to enhance physician-patient communication, particularly in managing distress among pediatric patients. I believe combining empathy, rigorous science, and immersive technology transforms healthcare education and outcomes.

Previously, I served as a Regulatory Affairs Specialist at Iran FDA, overseeing compliance for medical devices and AI systems. Alongside academia, I support startups and freelancers by developing prototypes, conducting market research, and designing scalable business models.

My technical expertise includes Python, MATLAB, C++, C#, JavaScript, Unreal Engine, Unity, and advanced game development tools like Daz3D, iClone, and Maya. I thrive on building intelligent, interactive systems bridging data science, immersive technology, and real-world impact.

Visit my Google Scholar for publications, or explore the Work section for my projects. I am always open to collaborations redefining the future of health technology.
